get.description: Get a list of markets (quantity and price precisions, order minimums and maximums, status).

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The market symbol to filter (optional, by default returns all markets)

get.description: Get OHLCV (open, highest, lowest, close, volume) information. The last entry in the OHLCV array is for the current.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of `interval` entries (with an `interval` of 15 minutes and `limit` 4 the response is the last hour with 4 entries)

200.description: OHLCV at interval for time range

get.description: Get the order book associated to the market symbol.

Get ticker information (OHLCV, current best bid and ask, percentage versus price 24 hours ago) for all markets or by requested market symbol. The data refers to the last 24 hours from the date indicated by the timestamp.
Get a list of last trades. Returns the last 50 trades by default.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of trades to retrieve

post.description:
Place a new order.
> See the [GET markets endpoint](#tag/MarketData/paths/~1v1~1trading~1market-config/get) for details on the available trading assets, their price and quantity precisions,
order minimums, etc.

400.description: Invalid market symbol, side or order type

412.description: Price or amount values invalid for minimum and maximum market configuration

get.description:
Get all user orders paged with a maximum page size of 100. The result can be filtered by dates, list of statuses,
side and market symbol optionally.

parameters.name: status_ne
parameters.description: Comma separated NOT EQUAL order statuses

parameters.name: status_ni
parameters.description: Comma separated NOT IN order statuses

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of orders retrieved

get.description: Get order details by order identifier.

delete.description: Cancel the order by identifier if this order is open or inactive.

get.description: Get all trades associated to the order.

Get all user trades paged with a maximum page size of 50.
The result can be filtered by dates and side optionally.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of trades to fetch

get.description: Retrieve balances of all wallets and blocked balances in active orders.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Comma separated symbols of the wallets that you want to retrieve

post.description: Request deposit funds into your Pro account from a Bit2Me Wallet.
Rquest withdraw funds into your Bit2Me wallet from Pro account.

An authentication token must be requested via this REST API endpoint in order to connect to and authenticate with our WebSockets API.
The token should be used within 1 minute of creation, but it does not expire once a successful WebSockets connection and private
subscription has been made and is maintained.

x-codeSamples.label: Node

ExplorerMultipleAddressParam.name: addr
ExplorerMultipleAddressParam.description: The address id (use a comma delimited list to use multiple addresses)

QuerySubtypeParam.name: subtype
QuerySubtypeParam.description: Specify the transaction subtype to filter the entries to be returned (or comma delimited list of subtypes)

QueryMethodParam.name: method
QueryMethodParam.description: Specify the transaction method to filter the entries to be returned (or comma delimited list of methods)

currency.description: Currency symbol, it should be an allowed currency

isNew.description: Currency added on earn in the last 7 days

currenciesRewardAllowed.description: Currency rewards allowed with their info

extraYield.description: Extra Yield by currency applied in the reward

stateCode.description:
Value obtained from 'fips' (Federal Information Processing Standard  (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Information_Processing_Standards)) field in /v1/misc/country/{countryISOCode}/region response.

  Additional information of this endpoint is available in misc section

TransactionSubsFeeTypeParam.description:
Indicates if the amount of the transaction is what the receiver will get or what will be deducted from the sender's balance:
 * SEA: Acronym for Send Exact Amount
 * REA: Acronym for Receive Exact Amount

minAmount.description: Minimum order amount (in terms of base currency)

maxAmount.description: Maximum order amount (in terms of base currency)

minPrice.description: Minimum order price (in terms of quote currency)

maxPrice.description: Maximum order price (in terms of quote currency)

minOrderSize.description: Minimum order size (in terms of base amount per quote price)

tickSize.description: Decimal number representing scaling decimals places for price

marketEnabledAt.description: Date on which the market has started. It can be a past date if the market is enabled or a future date if the status (`marketEnabled`) is `enabled_at`

initialPrice.description: Initial market price. If the market is not yet enabled, the orders must take that reference price to be placed above or below

timestamp.description: Ticker fetched timestamp (`Unix epoch time format`)

bid.description: Highest price a buyer will pay for order

ask.description: Lowest price a seller will take for order

high.description: Highest price in the last 24 hours

low.description: Lowest price in the last 24 hours

percentage.description: Percentage of current price versus opening price

baseVolume.description: Volume traded in terms of the base currency

quoteVolume.description: Volume traded in terms of the quote currency

items.description: Entries containing timestamp (`Unix epoch time format`), open, high, low, close and volume (in terms of the base currency)

asks.description: Entries containing sell orders with price and volume

bids.description: Entries containing buy orders with price and volume

oneOf.description: Price, amount and timestamp (`Unix epoch time format`) of trade

price.description: Price for `limit` orders in quote currency

stopPrice.description: Trigger price for `stop-limit` orders in quote currency

filledAmount.description: Filled order size in terms of base currency

dustAmount.description: Difference amount between the order amount and the filled amount when the order status is filled

feeAmount.description: Fee percentage respect to trade amount `amount`

updatedAt.description: Last datetime the order was updated

cancelReason.description: Detailed message about order cancel reason

price.description: Price trade was executed at (currency indicated by `priceCurrency` field)

isMaker.description: `true` if trade was executed with user as the maker, `false` if taker

feePercentage.description: Fee percentage respect to trade amount `amount`

blockedBalance.description: Balance in use on active orders

price.description: Price for `limit` orders in quote currency

stopPrice.description: Trigger price for `stop-limit` orders in quote currency

amountInQuote.description: Option to express volume in quote currency. This option is supported only for market orders. When using this parameter, Bit2Me calculates market price of the asset and immediately executes the order. This means that 100% precision is not guaranteed. When using this feature, you acknowledge that you understand how this works and accept that the differences arising from this method are not an error and are not Bit2Me responsibility to fix or provide you with additional information.

UnixEpochFilterParam.description: Time in Unix epoch time format

ISODateTimeParam.description: Date time in ISO 8601 string format

OHLCVIntervalParam.description: The interval of entries in minutes: 1, 5, 15, 30, 60 (1 hour), 240 (4 hours), 1440 (1 day)

PostOnlyParam.description: Indicates that limit order can only be created as a maker, otherwise it is not created (only for limit orders)

OrderStatusParam.description: Order status. The stop limit order remains inactive until the stop price is reached, then it becomes open or filled

TimeInForceParam.description:
Time-in-force of the order to specify how long it should remain in the order book before being cancelled:
GTC (Good-'til-cancelled) is default if the parameter is omitted.
IOC (Immediate-or-cancel) will immediately execute the amount possible and cancel any remaining balance rather than resting in the book.
FOK (Fill-or-kill) will immediately wait for order to be fully executed without taking the risk of receiving partial fills

MarketConfigOperationEnabledParam.description: The current status of the market. The market can be enabled, disabled, enabled at specified date in the `marketEnabledAt` field, or frozen, which does not allow orders to be added or deleted

CostParam.description: Total cost by multiplying amount by price

OffsetParam.description: The number of records the result should skip being the page size the `limit` field
